name: WINGMAN - Responsive WooCommerce Theme
intro: Thank you for your purchasing this template. If you have any questions that are beyond the scope of this help file, please feel free to email us via our user page contact form.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
Theme Installation via WordPress

Step 1 – Download the theme package(All files and documentation) from Themeforest and extract it.

Step 2 – Login to your WordPress admin panel

Step 3 – Go to Appearances > Themes

Step 4 – Click on Upload Theme

Step 5 – Upload the theme file named wingman.zip. The Theme package that you downloaded from themeforest is the Master file that will include Theme File, Child Theme file and Documentation. You have to extract this and upload the just the file in it named wingman.zip.

Step 6 – Install and Activate the theme

Step 7 - After activating the theme a notice should appear on the top of the screen, click on begin installing plugins.

Step 8 - Select all the plugin,change Bulk Actions drop to Install then click apply.

Step 9 - Congratulation you are ready to use Wingman, check the First Steps part of our documentation to see what you may want to do before starting to edit your WordPress Site.

 

Installing the theme via FTP

Step 1 – Log into your Hosting server using FTP service like Filezilla

Step 2 – In the Theme’s buyers package, unzip the file called wingman.zip

Step 3 – Upload only the Extracted folder ‘wingman’  to the folder wp-content/themes/

Step 4 – To activate the theme, navigate to Appearances > Themes in your wordpress Dashboard

Step 5 – Click on ‘Activate’ button under the theme name

Step 6 - After activating the theme a notice should appear on the top of the screen, click on begin installing plugins.

Step 7 - Select all the plugin,change Bulk Actions drop to Install then click apply ( see screenshots below ).

Step 8 - Congratulation you are ready to use Wingman, check the First Steps part of our documentation to see what you may want to do before starting to edit your WordPress Site.

sections.title: Importing Demo Content
sections.content:
The importer should be run only once. If something went wrong and you need to import the content again, you may need to reset your WordPress.

Use this plugin to reset the WordPress database : http://wordpress.org/plugins/wordpress-database-reset/

 

One Click Importer

Step 1 - Log into your WordPress Dasrdoard.

Step 2 - Go to Install Demos.

Step 3 - Then Click on Install.

Step 4 - The Dummy content is really big and may takes more then 10 minutes to import depending where you are living, Do not interrupt/cancel the import process!

Step 6 - Done!.

 

WordPress Importer

Step 1 - Log into your WordPress Dasrdoard.

Step 2 - Go to Tools > Import. Then click on WordPress ( bottom of the list ).

Step 3 - A window should appear click the Install now button which is on bottom right.

Step 4 - Click Activate plugin & Run Importer. Then choose the all file xml in folder dummy-data/folderdemo/ and click upload file and import Do not interrupt/cancel the import process!

Step 6 - Done!.

sections.title: Set up Home and Blog Page
sections.content:
Step 1 – Create Blog Page
Navigate  to Pages > Add New. Give the page a name of your choice and PUBLISH the page.

 

Step 2 – Assign Blog Page and Home Page
On your dashboard Navigate to Settings > Reading. Set up the Home Page under the ‘Front Page’ and Blog Page(The empty page that you created in Step -1) under ‘Posts Page’ drop down.

sections.title: Menu Setup
sections.content:
Once you have imported the content and settings, all the Menus will be imported, but you can change the menu location.

Step 1 – Go to Appearances > Menus

Step 2 – Select the Menu you need from the Drop Down. The menu that belong to the demo’s can be identified by the prefix. (Ex . V2 Main Menu)

Step  3 – Set Menu Location, by enabling the checkbox at the bottom of the page and Save the menu.

sections.title: Updating the theme
sections.content:
We will be updating the theme periodically with additional features and refinements. So it is vital that you know how to update the theme to stay current. 

 

Backing up Options Panel Data

Before you update the theme, it is recommended that you take a backup of the Options Panel settings. Log on to your site’s admin panel. On your Dashboard, navigate to Theme Options  -> Import / Export  and then download (Export) the options panel settings. This backup is to ensure that you can restore your options & settings incase something goes wrong during the theme update process. We strongly recommend doing this, though it is not mandatory

Updating the Theme

Step 1 – Download the latest version of the theme by logging on to your Themeforest account  and then navigating to the “Downloads” section.
Step 2 – Extract the theme package and unzip the ‘wingman.zip’ file. Connect to your server via FTP and navigate to /wp-content/themes folder of your wordpress installation, replace the existing folder named “wingman” with the unzipped folder.

Images

Any Images or logos used in previews are not included in this item or final purchase and you need to contact authors to get permission in case you want to use them in your commercial or non-commercial projects.

We used http://placehold.it/ for placeholders.

sections.title: Support
sections.content:
Thank you for supporting us and we will be extremely happy to assist you with the usage of our products.

 

Support Rules

We are based in VietNam and our support hours are between 8 AM – 5 PM (GMT + 7) Monday to Friday. Support tickets received during weekends will be responded to on the first day of the following week based on the order in which they were received.

Support for my items includes:

  • Responding to questions or problems regarding the item and its features
  • Fixing bugs and reported issues
  • Providing updates to ensure compatibility with new software versions

Item support does not include:

  • Customization and installation services
  • Support for third party software and plug-ins

sections.title: FAQs
sections.content:
How to add custom fonts in my site. I have the .tff files.

We currently do not have an option to upload custom fonts from the backend and the child theme method as given below is the way to go.

1 . Generate a @font face kit of your font using the tool in this link http://www.fontsquirrel.com/tools/webfont-generator ,
2. Install the Oshin child theme and in its style.css file you have to import the stylesheet file that you find inside the @fontface package you generated in the above step.
3. Apply the fonts to the appropriate html tags using custom css, in your child theme.

 

I am getting Internal Server error while trying to import demo data.

This will occur when you do not have the sufficient memory limits. Below is the memory limits required for a WP theme.

max_execution_time = 300
max_input_time = 120
memory_limit = 128M
post_max_size = 10M
upload_max_filesize = 10M

You can check this in the php.ini file and modify them as necessary. If you are not familiar with modifying this, you can reach out to your server hosting provider who should be able to configure this for you.

 

I see that my pages don’t look like they are in the demo. What could be the reason?

If you have imported the demo content using the One Click Import plugin, you can be sure that all the pages have been imported and the layouts will be intact. The difference that you see is due to the difference in the images. The Images used in the demo are all copyrighted and we do not have permissions to re-distrubute them. This is the reason why we have replaced the images in the export content that is shipped with the theme.

 

How do I disable Comments in each page?

On your dashboard, navigate to Theme Options > Page panel, and disable the option 'Show comments on page' in there.
